channel.title: 4DN News and Announcements

item.title: Keystone Symposia: Higher-Order Chromatin Architecture in Time and Space
item.description: The 2020 Keystone meeting is meant to highlight new frontiers across disciplines in tackling the dynamics and functional roles of the 3D genome in cellular functions across time and space in development and disease. When: March 15 - 19, 2020. Where: Whistler Conference Centre, Whistler, BC, Canada. Scientific Organizers: Jennifer E. Phillips-Cremins, Job Dekker and Stavros Lomvardas.

item.title: Four new (Phase 2) 4D Nucleome RFAs are out
item.description: Four new 4DN RFAs have just been published today! The announcement can be seen on the NIH Common Fund Website (https://commonfund.nih.gov/4dnucleome).

item.title: Outreach activity from Prof. Ting Wang at City of Hope
item.description: Ting Wang (Washington University): WashU Epigenome Browser: Engaging ENCODE, Roadmap Epigenomics, and 4DN.

item.title: Outreach activity from Prof. Ting Wang at City of Hope
item.description: Ting Wang (Washington University): WashU Epigenome Browser: Hands on demo.

item.title: 4DN Directory system launched!
item.description: 4DN OH has developed and deployed 4DN Directory, a centralized and integrated system for all 4DN personnel information where members can access the information of all 4DN members.
